Target: Users in Angola, Armenia, Botswana, Egypt, Indonesia, Kazakhstan, Mongolia, Oman, the Philippines, Saudi Arabia, and Trinidad and Tobago
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future identify a new infrastructure likely used by the operators of the commercial spyware known as Predator in at least 11 countries.
Country: AO AM BW EG ID KZ MN OM PH SA TT

Description: Researchers from Sucuri identified a fresh wave of SocGholish (fake browser update) infections targeting WordPress websites.

Target: Mac users in the crypto space
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes unveil a campaign where cyber criminals are targeting Mac users interested in cryptocurrency opportunities with fake calendar invites. During the attacks the criminals will send a link supposedly to add a meeting to the target’s calendar. In reality the link runs a script to install Mac malware on the target’s machine.
Muscatine Power and Water warns the public of a ransomware attack discovered on January 26.
Mr Green Gaming, a game community, suffers a breach when an inactive admin account is exploited, resulting in the leak of personal details belonging to 27,000 members.

Author: RA World
Target: Several healthcare organizations in the Latin American region
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a campaign from the RA World ransomware group, targeting several healthcare organizations in the Latin American region.
American Express warns customers that credit cards were exposed in a third-party data breach after a merchant processor was hacked.

Author: TA577
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint identify the threat actor TA577 using a new attack chain to demonstrate an uncommonly observed objective: stealing NT LAN Manager (NTLM) authentication information.

Author: TA577
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint identify a second campaign by the threat actor TA577 using a new attack chain to demonstrate an uncommonly observed objective: stealing NT LAN Manager (NTLM) authentication information.

Author: Kimsuky a.k.a. Thallium, Velvet Chollima, and KTA082
Description: Researchers from Kroll reveal that the North Korean APT hacking group Kimsuky is exploiting ScreenConnect flaws, particularly CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709, to infect targets with a new malware variant dubbed ToddlerShark.

Author: Threat actors from North Korea
Target: Two South Korean microchip equipment companies
Description: The South Korean National Intelligence Service (NIS) reveal that North Korean hackers breached at least two South Korean microchip equipment companies in recent months, stealing product design drawings and facility site photos.

Author: Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of Ukraine's Ministry of Defense
Description: The Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of Ukraine's Ministry of Defense claims that it breached the servers of the Russian Ministry of Defense (Minoborony) and stole sensitive documents.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a Trojan, dubbed CHAVECLOAK, targeting Brazilian banking users via malicious PDFs.

Author: LockBit
Description: Fidelity Investments Life Insurance informs roughly 28,000 individuals that their personal information was compromised in a data breach at third-party services provider Infosys McCamish System (IMS).
South St. Paul Public Schools alerts families to an ongoing technology disruption that is being investigated.

Author: Russia
Description: Russia publishes an intercepted conversation via Webex, in which Bundeswehr officials discuss the country’s support for Ukraine, particularly around the supply of Taurus cruise missiles.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: GhostSec and Stormous
Target: Organizations in Lebanon, Israel, South Africa, Turkey, Egypt, India, Vietnam, and Thailand, as well as other locations.
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that two ransomware groups, GhostSec and Stormous, have joined forces in attack campaigns with double-extortion attacks using the new GhostLocker 2.0 ransomware.
Country: EG IL IN LB TH TR VN ZA >1

Description: Canada’s financial intelligence agency FINTRAC (Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada) announces pulling its corporate systems offline due to a cyber incident that struck over the weekend.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Zscaler discover a threat actor creating fraudulent Skype, Google Meet, and Zoom websites to spread the SpyNote RAT to Android users and NjRAT and DCRat to Windows users.

Target: Organizations in Japan, Singapore, China, Hong Kong, and other Asian countries
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a new malware dubbed 'WogRAT' targeting both Windows and Linux in attacks abusing an online notepad platform named 'aNotepad' as a covert channel for storing and retrieving malicious code.
Apple releases emergency security updates to address two iOS zero-day vulnerabilities, respectively tracked as CVE-2024-23225 and CVE-2024-23296, exploited in attacks against iPhone devices.
Researchers from Kaspersky detect Malicious actors abusing the open-source hypervisor platform QEMU as a tunneling tool in a cyberattack against a large company.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a new variant of the Angel Drainer campaign resulting in distributed brute force attacks against target WordPress websites.

Author: Jasmin
Description: Security researchers uncover multiple cases of JetBrains TeamCity exploitation (CVE-2024-27198, CVE-2024-27199) being followed up by deployments of (suspected modified) Jasmin Ransomware.
Researchers from CYFIRMA discover a destructive malware of Russian origin dubbed WinDestroyer.

Author: ALPHV a.k.a. BlackCat
Description: Researchers from Sygnia reveal the details of a ransomware attack carried out from the BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware operation.
Decentralized finance platform WOOFi experiences an $8.75 million exploit when an unidentified hacker used flash loans to manipulate the algorithm.

Author: TA4903
Target: Organizations in various industries including construction, manufacturing, energy, finance, food and beverage, and other
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint observe an increase in credential phishing and fraud campaigns from TA4903, spoofing various small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across various industries including construction, manufacturing, energy, finance, food and beverage,
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2021-36380 Sunhillo SureLine OS Command Injection Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
"The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2023-21237 Android Pixel Information Disclosure Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Pet retail giant PetSmart warns some customers their passwords were reset due to an ongoing credential stuffing attack attempting to breach accounts.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors start to exploit the critical-severity authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-27198) in TeamCity On-Premises.
The city of Hamilton is still recovering from a ransomware attack that has affected nearly every facet of government functions.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Stormous
Description: The Stormous ransomware gang takes credit for an attack on Duvel Moortgat Brewery, a major Belgian beer producer.

Author: Earth Kapre a.k.a. RedCurl, Red Wolf
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Russian-speaking cybercrime group called RedCurl is leveraging a legitimate Microsoft Windows component called the Program Compatibility Assistant (PCA) to execute malicious commands.
Nations Direct Mortgage say more than 83,000 customers were affected by a late 2023  data breach that leaked Social Security numbers and other sensitive information.

Author: Lotus Bane (overlapping with OceanLotus a.k.a. APT32, Canvas Cyclone, Bismuth, and Cobalt Kitty)
Target: Organizations in the financial space in Vietnam
Description: Researchers from Group-IB discover a previously undocumented threat actor called Lotus Bane targeting financial entities in Vietnam.
As Russia prepares for its presidential election, its systems are reportedly being targeted by “massive” cyberattacks, according to local authorities.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: South Africa Companies and Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC)
Description: Sensitive data on businesses and individuals in South Africa is at risk after a cyberattack on the Companies and Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC) agency.
Researchers from Cado Security discover a new campaign named "Spinning YARN" using a new Linux malware campaign targeting misconfigured Apache Hadoop, Confluence, Docker, and Redis instances.
Researchers from Cybereason warn that threat actors are utilizing Facebook messages to spread the Snake malware, a Python-based information stealer.
Researchers from Sucuri discover an uptick in attacks from a new malware campaign targeting this same Popup Builder vulnerability.

Author: Tycoon and Storm-1575
Description: Researchers from PIXM reveal that public schools across the United States are facing a surge in sophisticated phishing campaigns linked to two threat groups: Tycoon and Storm-1575.
Researchers from Inquest reveal the details of Planet stealer, a malware utilized in recent campaigns.

Author: 'emo'
Description: Financial services firm Paysign says it is investigating reports of a data breach involving consumer information after a threat actor tried to sell a database allegedly belonging to the company containing 1,242,575 records of records.

Author: INC
Target: Leicester City Council. The INC ransomware claims responsibility for the attack.
Description: The Leicester City Council is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: Lord Nemesis a.k.a. Nemesis Kitten
Description: Researchers from OP Innovate reveal that an Iranian state-backed hacking group recently infiltrated Rashim Software, and used that access to intimidate other Israeli organizations.
Researchers from Cofense discover a two-month campaign that used SVG files to deliver the Agent Tesla Keylogger and the XWorm RAT malware.

Author: Evasive Panda (a.k.a. BRONZE HIGHLAND and Daggerfly)
Target: Tibetans in several countries and territories
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a cyberespionage campaign that leverages the Monlam Festival – a religious gathering – to target Tibetans in several countries and territories via watering hole and supply chain attacks.

The Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission blocks fake websites posing as major local cryptocurrency exchanges, impersonating two licensed exchanges in Hong Kong: OSL Digital Securities and Hash Blockchain Limited, also known as HashKey.
Researchers from Darktrace discover a novel phishing campaign leveraging legitimate Dropbox infrastructure and successfully bypassing multifactor authentication (MFA) protocols

Author: Magnet Goblin
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a financially motivated group named Magnet Goblin, using various 1-day vulnerabilities to breach public-facing servers and deploy custom malware on Windows and Linux systems.

Target: U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA)
Description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) discloses that threat actors breached their systems in February through vulnerabilities in Ivanti products
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: BianLian
Description: Researchers from Guidepoint discover that the BianLian ransomware group, is gaining initial access to the target by exploiting flaws in a TeamCity server.
Roku says it canceled unauthorized subscriptions and refunded more than 15,000 accounts after discovering what they called “suspicious activity.”

Author: DoNex
Description: A new ransomware strain dubbed 'DoNex' is observed in the wild targeting organizations in multiple countries.

Author: APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, Nobelium, The Dukes)
Description: Microsoft reveals that APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, Nobelium, The Dukes) used the information initially exfiltrated from their corporate email systems to access portions of the source code.

Author: APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, Nobelium, The Dukes)
Description: Microsoft reveals that APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, Nobelium, The Dukes) is using information initially exfiltrated from their corporate email systems to gain, or attempt to gain, unauthorized access.

Author: China
Description: A report published by Lithuanian security services warne that China has escalated its espionage operations against Lithuania.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: IntelBroker
Description: The threat actor known as IntelBroker claims responsibility for a data breach targeting Acuity, a Federal contractor. The breach resulted in the theft of sensitive data and documents from two prominent U.S. government entities: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS). One month later Acuity confirms the breach.
Attack: Vulnerability in an Acuity Tekton CI/CD server

Target: Users of the Leather cryptocurrency wallet app
Description: The developers of the Leather cryptocurrency wallet warn of a fake app on the Apple App Store, with users reporting it is a wallet drainer that stole their digital assets.
Koffie Beyers, a Belgian coffee roaster, is hit with a cyber attack.
A number of French government agencies are hit by “intense” cyberattacks
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Sysdig discover a malicious campaign using the blockchain-based Meson service to create 6,000 Meson Network nodes using a compromised cloud account.
The Russian independent media organization Meduza says that it has been targeted by an “unprecedented” cyber campaign ahead of the upcoming presidential election.

Author: Fancy Bear (aka APT28, Forest Blizzard, Frozenlake, Sofacy Group, Strontium, UAC-028, ITG05)
Target: Organizations in Argentina, Ukraine, Georgia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Poland, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and the United States.
Description: Researchers from IBM discover a targeted campaign by the Russian threat actor Fancy Bear.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Country: AM AR AZ BY GE KZ PL UA US

Description: Researchers from Dr.Web reveal the details of a targeted attack against an undisclosed Russian mechanical-engineering organization.
La Mesa temporarily suspends public comments via Zoom following a rash of antisemitic hate speech during last month's City Council meeting.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from ReversingLabs discover BIPClip, a campaign using PyPI packages posing as open-source libraries to steal BIP39 mnemonic phrases, which are used for wallet recovery.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: As the tax deadline approaches, the U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) warns taxpayers about impersonation scams.

Researchers from Scam Sniffer reveal that impersonated accounts on X (formerly Twitter) are blamed for the majority of cryptocurrency phishing attacks during February 2024, with victims losing almost $47M.

Author: LockBit
Target: South African Government Pensions Administration Agency (GPAA)
Description: The LockBit ransomware gang says it was behind an attack on South Africa’s government workers pension fund last month, which has hampered the organization’s operations and disrupted pension payments.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: ph1ns'
Description: Acer Philippines confirms that employee data was stolen in an attack on a third-party vendor who manages the company's employee attendance data after a threat actor with the moniker of 'ph1ns' leaked the data on a hacking forum.
Researchers from Threatdown discover a campaign delivering the FakeBat malware via several active malvertising campaigns.
Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign distributing an infostealer called Tweaks (aka Tweaker) that targets Roblox users.
Researchers from Fortinet uncover a phishing campaign enticing users to download a malicious Java downloader with the intention of spreading new VCURMS and STRRAT remote access trojans.
A cyberattack dirsrupts operations at MarineMax, one of the world’s biggest boat sellers. The Rhysida ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a DarkGate campaign where DarkGate operators exploited the Microsoft Windows SmartScreen bypass CVE-2024-21412 Vulnerability.
Researchers from IBM discover a new version of the PixPirate banking trojan for Android employing a new method to hide on phones while remaining active, even if its dropper app has been removed.
France Travail, formerly known as Pôle Emploi, warns that threat actors breached its systems and may leak or exploit personal details of an estimated 43 million individuals.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that threat actors are leveraging digital document publishing (DDP) sites hosted on platforms like FlipSnack, Issuu, Marq, Publuu, RelayTo, and Simplebooklet for carrying out phishing, credential harvesting, and session token theft.

Author: Anonymous Sudan
Description: The hacktivist group Anonymous Sudan claims credit for a cyberattack that disrupts Alabama state government.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from G-Data discover 'gitgub', a campaign exploiting at least 13 Github repositories hosting cracked software designed to deliver the RisePro info-stealer.
Documentation startup Mintlify says dozens of customers had GitHub tokens exposed in a data breach at the start of the month.

Researchers from Kaspersky discover a malvertising campaign targeting Chinese users looking for legitimate software such as Notepad++ and VNote on search engines like Baidu to distribute trojanized versions of the software and ultimately deploy Geacon, a Golang-based implementation of Cobalt Strike.

Author: M762
Description: Researchers from Resecurity discover TMChecker, a new toolset on the dark web, gaining traction as an attack weapon to target remote access services and popular e-commerce platforms.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Target: Individuals in Russia and other countries
Description: Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. reveal that SIM swappers have adapted their attacks to steal a target's phone number by porting it into a new eSIM card.

Target: RAF plane carrying U.K. Defence Secretary Grant Shapps
Description: An RAF plane carrying U.K. Defence Secretary Grant Shapps has its GPS signal jammed while flying close to Russian territory.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: New Mexico Administrative Office of the District Attorneys
Description: The New Mexico Administrative Office of the District Attorneys is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: INC
Description: NHS Dumfries and Galloway, part of the Scottish healthcare system, announces it was the target “of a focused and ongoing cyber attack.” The INC ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Author: BlackByte
Description: Encina Wastewater Authority (EWA) is hit by the BlackByte ransomware group.
The Scranton School District is hit with a ransomware attack.
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) discloses that a cyberattack in February led to the compromise of 11 email accounts.
Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a new version of the BunnyLoader malware, characterized by new evasion techniques.

Author: ShadowSyndicate
Description: Researchers from Cyble observe the ransomware actor 'ShadowSyndicate' scanning for servers vulnerable to CVE-2024-23334, a directory traversal vulnerability in the aiohttp Python library.

Researchers from Netskope discover an evasive Azorult campaign in the wild, employing multiple defense evasion techniques from delivery through execution to fly under the defender’s radar as it steals sensitive data.
Japanese tech giant Fujitsu discloses that several of its systems were infected by malware and warns that the hackers stole customer data.

The city of Birmingham, Alabama, experiences outages limiting government services more than a week after a network “disruption” forced officials to switch to cash transactions and to take other temporary actions.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Brocom/Symantec discover a malware-as-a-service (MaaS) campaign targeting Android users based in India.
